snippet: Russia and China bear responsibility for Bashar al-Assad’s crimes by vetoing a United Nations Security Council resolution calling for a peaceful transfer of power in Syria.
abstract: Editorial contends that Russia and China share responsibility for a bloody spike in Syrian violence, after they vetoed a United Nations Security Council resolution calling for a peaceful transfer of power; asserts that Russia bears even more responsibility in light of its profitable arms sales to Damascus.
lead_paragraph: Russia and China bear responsibility for Bashar al-Assad’s crimes by vetoing a United Nations Security Council resolution calling for a peaceful transfer of power in Syria.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
